clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Enhanced External Counterpulsation Treatment to Lower Urinary Tract Symptoms

lead_sponsor.agency: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to see if enhanced external counterpulsation treatment can improve lower tract symptoms.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: evaluated lower urinary tract symptoms by International Prostate Symptom Score

arm_group.description: Men with lower urinary tract symptoms included for evaluating the lower urinary tract symptoms before and after the Enhanced external counterpulsation treatment

intervention.description: Enhanced external counterpulsation(EECP) is used in cardiovascular and cerebrovascular diseases，which has the ability to improve the microcirculation

study_pop.textblock: Men complaining lower urinary tract symptoms were enrolled

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: First Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University
